meanings.definition: To guide or direct in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: The teacher shepherded the students to the library for storytime.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide shepherded the group through the museum.
meanings.sent3: The duck shepherded the ducklings to the pond for a swim.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse shepherded ships safely through the rocky waters.
meanings.sent5: The shepherd shepherded his flock of sheep across the meadow at sunset.

meanings.definition: To watch over and care for a group of people or animals
meanings.sent1: The babysitter shepherded the children at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The farmer shepherded the sheep in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The cat shepherded the kittens back to their cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: The lifeguard shepherded swimmers to safety during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The ranger shepherded the hikers along the trail in the national park.

meanings.definition: To lead or guide someone or something in a particular way
meanings.sent1: The coach shepherded the team to victory with his strategic plays.
meanings.sent2: The mentor shepherded the new employee through their first week.
meanings.sent3: The bee shepherded the other bees to the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent4: The compass shepherded the lost hiker back to the trailhead.
meanings.sent5: The parent shepherded their child through the maze at the amusement park.
